ai_explanation.introduction_japanese: 下ろすは、物を下に動かす、降ろす、荷物や人を車やバスから降ろす、髪をほどいて下に下げるなど、動作や日常の場面でよく使う動詞です。
ai_explanation.introduction_english: The verb おろす is commonly used in everyday situations to talk about moving something down, taking people or luggage off vehicles, lowering blinds or flags, and letting hair down.
meanings: to take down; to bring down; to lower (a hand, flag, shutter, etc.); to drop (an anchor, curtain, etc.); to let down (hair); to launch (a boat)
to drop off (a passenger); to let off; to unload (goods, a truck, etc.); to offload; to discharge
to use for the first time; to wear for the first time
to cut off; to fillet (fish); to grate (e.g. radish); to prune (branches)
to remove (someone from a position); to oust; to drop (esp. 降ろす)
to clear (the table); to remove (offerings from an altar); to pass down; to hand down
to expel from the body (e.g. worms); to abort (a fetus)
to invoke (a spirit); to call down
ai_explanation.meaning_explanation_japanese: 「下ろす」は、何かを上から下に動かすことや、車から人や荷物を降ろすこと、お金を引き出すこと、初めて使う・身につけること、魚をおろす（さばく）など、色々な場面で「下へ移す・取り除く」という意味で使います。
ai_explanation.meaning_explanation_english: The word おろす means moving something down or removing it: lowering objects, taking people or luggage off a vehicle, withdrawing money, using or wearing something for the first time, or preparing/filleting food. It broadly expresses 'bringing down' or 'offloading.'
ai_explanation.kanji_explanation_english: The first kanji means below or down. In the word ちか it helps give the idea of something being under the ground, like underground. In the word へた it adds the image of being lower in skill compared to others.
synonyms: 降ろす : おろす : to lower; to drop off
卸す : おろす : to wholesale; to distribute (goods)
ai_explanation.synonyms_explanation: The most common synonyms of the word are おろす and おろす. The first (written with ふるえる kanji different from the main one) is often used for getting people or things down (like dropping off passengers). The second (おろす written as wholesale kanji) focuses on selling or distributing goods; both share the basic idea of "moving something away/down."
antonyms: 上げる : あげる : to raise; to lift up
載せる : のせる : to put on; to load onto
ai_explanation.antonyms_explanation: The most common antonyms of the word are あげる and のせる. あげる expresses moving something up or raising it, the opposite of lowering. のせる means to put or load something onto a vehicle or surface, which is the reverse action of unloading or 下ろす.

examples.furigana: 荷物(にもつ)を下ろす(おろす)。

translations.ES: Deja tu equipaje en el suelo.
translations.MY: မင်းရဲ့ ခရီးဆောင်အိတ်ကို ချလိုက်ပါ။

examples.furigana: お金(おかね)を下ろす(おろす)。

translations.MY: ငွေထုတ်ပါ။

examples.furigana: ブラインドを下ろす(おろす)。
バスから人(ひと)を下ろす(おろす)。

translations.ES: Sacar a la gente del autobús.
translations.VI: Đưa mọi người xuống xe buýt.
translations.FR: Faites descendre les gens du bus.
translations.TL: Ilabas ang mga tao sa bus.
translations.MY: လူတွေကို ဘတ်စ်ကားပေါ်က ဆင်းပါ။
translations.FA: مردم را از اتوبوس پیاده کنید.

examples.furigana: 髪(かみ)を下ろす(おろす)。

translations.MY: သင့်ဆံပင်ကို ချလိုက်ပါ။

examples.furigana: 棚(たな)から本(ほん)を下ろす(おろす)。

translations.EN: Take the book down from the shelf.
translations.VI: Lấy cuốn sách xuống khỏi kệ.
translations.TL: Ibaba ang libro mula sa istante.
translations.MY: စာအုပ်ကို စင်ပေါ်ကနေ ချလိုက်တယ်။
translations.HI: किताब को शेल्फ से नीचे उतारें।
translations.AR: خذ الكتاب إلى أسفل من الرف.
translations.FA: کتاب را از قفسه پایین بیاورید.
